item.title: Specifying an Image Extension at Build Time
item.description: Specifying an Image Extension at Build Time No builder can be truly omniscient, and whoever did yours surely was no exception! You need to add a little extra spice to the mix with this late-breaking extension, by doing something like: pack build [...] --extension=foo [...]

item.title: Specifying an Image Extension in the Builder
item.description: Specifying an Image Extension in the Builder You’re pretty sharp, and you know what your buildpack users will need. That’s why you’re going to add something similar to the following lines directly to builder.toml: [[order-extensions]] [[order-extensions.group]] id = "foo" version = "0.0.1" [[extensions]] id = "foo" version = "0.0.1" uri = "/local/path/to/extension/foo" # can be relative or absolute
